  physical_appearance: This is a multicoloured map of Java which was created by Gerard Van Keulen. This map
 divided into western and eastern parts
 has an inset map and view of Batavia.There are many lines of text in Dutch throughout the map specifying the names of places in Dutch-colonised Java in the 18th century.

  subject_terms_1: seas topography (attribute) hydrography cartography (discipline)

  subject_terms_2: Pictorial maps Seas Hydrography Cartography Navigation

  subject_terms_4: Jakarta (inhabited place) East Indies (general region) Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie Java (island)

  sgcool_label_text: This two-part map of Java was produced by Gerard van Keulen
 an engraver
 mathematician and hydrographer for the Dutch East India Company. It was published later by his son Johannes van Keulen II in Part VI of his collection of sea charts
 the Zee Fakkel
 in 1653. Apart from the main map which shows both West and East Java
 the insets provide a map and view of Batavia.

metadata.physical_appearance: This is a multicoloured map of Java which was created by Gerard Van Keulen. This map, divided into western and eastern parts, has an inset map and view of Batavia.There are many lines of text in Dutch throughout the map specifying the names of places in Dutch-colonised Java in the 18th century.
metadata.subject_terms_2: Pictorial maps Seas Hydrography Cartography Navigation
metadata.subject_terms_4: Jakarta (inhabited place) East Indies (general region) Nederlandsche Oost-Indische Compagnie Java (island)
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This two-part map of Java was produced by Gerard van Keulen, an engraver, mathematician and hydrographer for the Dutch East India Company. It was published later by his son Johannes van Keulen II in Part VI of his collection of sea charts, the Zee Fakkel, in 1653. Apart from the main map which shows both West and East Java, the insets provide a map and view of Batavia.
